item.title: Todd Howard Gives Update on Important Starfield Feature Fans Are Still Waiting On
item.description:
Highlights

  • Starfield fans eagerly anticipate the Creation Kit's arrival for more mods and flexibility in-game.
  • Mod support has been confirmed by Todd Howard, with some creators already testing out the Kit.
  • The Creation Kit could bring new content, fix bugs, and introduce assets from other Bethesda games.

Bethesda's Todd Howard updates fans regarding the Creation Kit, an important feature that will be coming to Starfield soon. Most Bethesda fans are already familiar with the concept of the Creation Kit. When The Elder Scrolls: Skryim launched its Creation Kit , around 2,500 mods were available in just a week's time. Since it allows for easier modification of game files, creators have more flexibility in-game. This is partly the reason why Starfield fans are highly excited about its introduction to the game.

As Starfield follows a similar formula to both Fallout and Elder Scrolls , fans have made a reasonable assumption that the Creation Kit will also come to the game. Todd Howard had also previously alluded to it in an interview with Famitsu in 2023 by stating that mod support "will be available next year." While mods already exist within the Starfield community, the introduction of the aforementioned Creation Kit would encourage more modders and creators to come up with original content, and would thereby add longevity in the game.

Related
Infamous Star Trek Ship Recreated in Starfield
A player adds their name to the already extensive list of impressive Starfield creations by crafting an infamous Star Trek ship within the game.

In a recent interview with Kinda Funny Games, Todd Howard gave a few statements regarding the Starfield Creation Kit. He mentioned that as the tool is coming soon, some creators actually have their hands on it. This is great news, as it means that once the Kit officially launches, there will already be several mods available for gamers to check out. Most notably, fans unfamiliar with the modding scene may be able to experience several mods, including the Star Wars ship mods , with ease.

Bethesda Games With Creation Kits

  • The Elder Scrolls: Skryim
  • Fallout 4

Historically, the Creation Kit has helped keep both Fallout and the Elder Scrolls alive. Skyrim regularly experiences resurgences in the gaming community because new mods help introduce new mechanics, and even an overhauled game at times. Starfield would be able to maintain a high player base, as well as find new audiences once the kit launches. One huge mod that currently exists is one that increases Starfield 's difficulty after every New Game+ . Once the tool launches, many people will be able to experience this challenge without the need for any complicated processes, which in turn would also give players more reason to continue playing.

With the game looking to continue its trajectory upwards, Todd Howard recently mentioned that good updates are coming soon to Starfield . The Creation Kit could also factor into this discussion. Not only will the modding tool be able to provide new content, there's also a way that the tool could help creators fix a lot of the existing glitches and bugs that plague the game. There's also a possibility that certain assets from other Bethesda games could be easily introduced. Starfield is looking to go all out as it moves forward into the future, and content and mod creators will soon be able to help shape the game into the ideal Skyrim in space that they've long wished for.

item.title: Minecraft Makes Big Changes to Realms
item.description:
Highlights

  • Realm Stories hub enhances communication for players, making event planning and resource gathering easier in Minecraft Realms.
  • An eight-chunk increase in render distance aids in locating areas and preparing for mob attacks in the game.
  • The monthly Character Creator packs add customizable cosmetic options for players with a subscription to Realms Plus.

Minecraft 's Realms and Realms Plus recently received an update that added new features to Realm Stories, an enhanced render distance, and access to cosmetic items. The changes are meant to increase communication across the realm for all players, as well as jazz up everyone's characters. Minecraft Realms are only available for the Bedrock edition of the title.

Realms and Realms Plus are Minecraft 's private server subscription service . First introduced in 2013, Realms allow friends to play together in a persistent world without worrying about other players wreaking havoc. Since launching, there have been multiple updates to the way these personal worlds function. The latest update focuses on communication between world members, event planning, and more.

Related
Minecraft: How To Install Plugins To A Minecraft Realm
Minecraft realms are a great way to share the Minecraft experience with friends, but plugins can improve the gameplay even further!

The latest update to Realms affects Realms Plus subscribers. The first is the inclusion of Realm Stories, a social hub for all realm participants. The hub features multiple tabs, including the Story Feed with live event updates. The Timeline tab shows when members are typically in-game, making it easy to plan realm events, when to hunt for resources together, or when a building buddy will be on next. The Member Tab shows all members of a realm, including visitors, and if they're online. This is great if something, like a spreading fire or mob attack, is happening and players need help. The Comment thread makes it easy to chat with everyone who's available, or leave messages on what the base needs.

Minecraft Realms Subscription Gets Three Major Updates

  • Realm Stories social hub with additional tabs
  • Increased Render Distance
  • Free monthly Character Creator pack

Along with the Realm Stories features, the render distance was increased by eight chunks on most platforms. This greatly helps when trying to set up a meeting zone and a player is having a hard time finding the location, or doesn't even have coordinates turned on in Minecraft Realms . Now, players can see farther into the distance, know when mobs are about to attack them earlier, and plan better escape routes. Some secret areas are likely to be discovered with the clarity this brings to the map.

The final addition to the service is access to a new set of Character Creator packs each month. This is similar to other monthly drops for subscription services. Once unlocked, the character cosmetics are permanent. Access to these packs requires the Marketplace, an additional feature players need to purchase or can be obtained through the new subscription service, Minecraft Marketplace Pass .

The update is a chunky one, featuring increased vision, communication, and cosmetics. Some players could find the communication improvements alone to be worth it. No longer will players stand about attempting to figure out what needs to be done, when the next event is, or how their base got destroyed.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Turns Poliwag Evolutionary Family into Delicious Cinnamon Rolls
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon fans love to create food that looks like their favorite characters, such as cinnamon rolls based on Poliwag and its evolutions.
  • The process of making Pokemon-inspired treats can be straightforward, like using a basic cinnamon roll recipe and adding colorful dough.
  • Fans can find inspiration for making Pokemon confections from fellow enthusiasts and official Pokemon snacks and cookbooks.

A Pokemon fan has baked a pan full of cinnamon rolls based off of Poliwag, its evolutions, and one special guest. The adorable recreations of the Pokemon have a strong resemblance, and definitely look good enough for Pokemon fans to eat.

Although some Pokemon are used as food in the games or TV series, many creative Pokemon fans think about making food that looks like Pokemon instead. Whether it's fans recreating their favorites as tasty treats or the Pokemon Company partnering with official brands to do things like create Pokemon donuts, the series and food often go hand-in-hand. With the round shape and the swirl on Poliwag's stomach, it's a perfect choice to base cinnamon rolls on.

Related
Pokemon Fan Creates Adorable Charmander-Themed Tabletop Fire Pit
A creative member of the Pokemon community shares their tabletop firepit design featuring the exceedingly popular Gen 1 Fire-type starter.

Pokemon fan and self-proclaimed "nerdy confectioner" miscellaneousmao has made a pan of cinnamon rolls based of of Poliwag, Poliwhirl, Poliwrath, Politoed, and even a Ditto disguised as one of the water-type Pokemon's family members. The round shape of the layers of cinnamon rolls takes the place of the Poli-Pokemons' stomach swirls perfectly. Even the tail of the Poliwags are included here, further adding charm to the overall designs.

According to miscellaneousmao, the process of making the Pokemon cinnamon rolls was pretty straightforward. They used a basic cinnamon roll recipe from the internet, made mini-rolls with half of the standard dough, and then dyed the remaining dough blue and green to get the colors they needed. They then wrapped the colored dough around the mini-rolls, iced them while warm, and finally added details for elements like the faces with chocolate after the rolls had fully cooled. The adorable results have gained plenty of fans for the overall designs and the presence of the disguised Ditto.

Making Treats with Pokemon Inspirations

Miscellaneousmao is no stranger to Pokemon treats, as they've made everything from custom Swablu marshmallows to creepy cakes that look like Slowpoke had its tail lopped off. They're not the only ones, as other Pokemon fans have made waves with things like Parasect melon pan buns. Another fan made a Poliwhirl roll cake that would fit in well with miscellaneousmao's cinnamon rolls, as well.

For fans who aren't expert bakers or those who lack inspiration, there's often opportunities to pick up Pokemon snacks from the official company, though some of them are limited to Japan. Pokemon cookbooks or snack kits like a Pokemon ice cream maker are also good choices for those who want to give making Pokemon confections a try for themselves.

item.title: Elden Ring Player Finds Possible Hidden Weapon in Shadow of the Erdtree Trailer
item.description:
Highlights

  • There is a potentially hidden weapon in the Elden Ring DLC trailer, possibly tied to a hand-to-hand combat mechanic.
  • Details spotted in the trailer suggest the belt may unlock a special attack. Fans are excited about the possibility of using it against a challenging boss.
  • The community awaits confirmation of the theory in the upcoming release.

An Elden Ring player has found a hidden weapon in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC trailer which many seem to have missed all this while. The hand-to-hand combat mechanic has been one of the most talked about aspects of the trailer, and it seems like the Elden Ring community has finally figured out what makes it possible.

The Shadow of the Erdtree DLC trailer was released a couple of months ago, and just like most FromSoftware reveals, it has managed to stir up quite a bit of intrigue around it. Fans have been debating about multiple aspects of the trailer, ranging from the origins of the protagonist Messmer to the purpose of some of the NPCs showcased. For instance, the latest obsession for the Elden Ring community seems to be the glowing worm showcased in the trailer, and many are eagerly waiting to interact with it in the game. Amid that, a new detail has emerged from the trailer.

Related
Elden Ring Fan Shows Off Melina Cosplay
An Elden Ring fan showcases a Melina cosplay, met with enthusiasm by the community, who praised the player for their work.

In a new post on the Elden Ring subreddit, user stargazr331 spots an interesting detail in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC trailer. During the sequence where the developers showcase the newly added hand-to-hand combat in Elden Ring , the character can be seen wearing a belt. While that might seem like a mere armor piece, what is crucial to note is that another promotional illustration that showcases the same dropkick attack also features the character wearing the crest.

While it is possible that this is just a mere coincidence, the fact that further solidifies the claim is that the rest of the Elden Ring armor set is entirely different in both situations. This likely suggests that it is the belt that might unlock the attack, something that fans have been curious to know more about for quite a while now.

Elden Ring Fans Want Revenge Against Hoarah Loux With New Weapon

Fans are excited about the possibility of a belt adding the melee combat option, with many drawing parallels with a championship belt. In particular, many seem to be excited about using it against Elden Ring 's Hoarah Loux , a boss who has some frustrating melee combat moves. Another interesting speculation is that the different styles of the belt could influence what fighting style the player could have. While players are already gearing up to design their martial arts-focused Elden Ring characters after seeing the hand-to-hand combat in the trailer, this new discovery seems to make the entire build even more fascinating for the community. Whether it actually turns out to be true or is just a coincidence remains to be seen.

item.title: Major World of Warcraft Leader Gets an Unexpected Makeover in The War Within
item.description:
Warning: Spoilers for World of Warcraft: The War Within below.

Highlights

  • Magni Bronzebeard, the former king of the Dwarves, is transformed back into flesh and blood in World of Warcraft: The War Within.
  • The War Within introduces a new multi-expansion storyline in WoW, with revamped models for major characters like Alleria, Anduin, and Xal’atath.
  • Azeroth stops speaking to Magni, leading to a major character transformation in The War Within.

During the events of World of Warcraft: The War Within , Magni Bronzebeard, the former king of the Dwarves and current Speaker of Azeroth, is turned back into flesh and blood. This major event happens during the World of Warcraft story campaign in the Ringing Deeps, the second zone of The War Within .

The War Within is the first installment of The Worldsoul Saga, a new multi-expansion storyline World of Warcraft is beginning in a few months. In addition to introducing tons of new characters, World of Warcraft is giving several major characters a facelift, with new models coming for Alleria, Anduin, and Xal’atath.

Related
World of Warcraft Destroys an Iconic Location in the First Hour of The War Within
World of Warcraft raises the stakes in The War Within in a big way, with a major landmark's annihilation within the first hour of the expansion.

However, another major character from World of Warcraft 's history is undergoing a major change as well. As the diamond-skinned Speaker of Azeroth, Magni Bronzebeard plays a major role in The War Within , alongside his daughter Moira and his grandson Dagran. During the Ringing Deeps zone story, Magni helps the Earthen confront one of their leaders, who has been deceived into working with Xal’atath, the main villain of WoW: The War Within . At its climax, Magni nearly dies to purge the corruption of an ancient Titan machine, saving the day, but transforming Magni into flesh and blood in the process.

Who is Magni Bronzebeard in World of Warcraft?

  • Magni is the eldest Bronzebeard brother, and former king of the Dwarves.
  • In Cataclysm , he turned into a diamond statue and was believed to be dead.
  • He awoke four in-game years later in Legion as the Speaker of Azeroth, and played a major role in both it and Battle for Azeroth .
  • In The War Within , Azeroth has stopped speaking to him, causing him to become jaded, and his diamond skin has grown dull.
  • In the Ringing Deeps storyline, Magni nearly dies to purge void corruption from an ancient machine integral to making new Earthen in World of Warcraft , and is turned back to flesh and blood.

Throughout the early parts of The War Within , it becomes clear that Magni has had a rough time during World of Warcraft ’s time skip in Dragonflight . Azeroth has stopped talking to him, and he has grown to resent his role as Speaker. That said, some fans wonder if Azeroth might have felt sorry for imposing the role on Magni and taking him from his family, and surmise that she began distancing herself to let him reconnect with his family – something he can do more easily now that he is flesh and blood again.

So far, World of Warcraft has tested two of its four zones in The War Within alpha, giving players a glimpse at a decent portion of the expansion’s story. Fans will have to see what else is in store for them in subsequent alpha builds, the beta, and finally, the full release of WoW: The War Within later this year .
